content.description: Crouch start left hand in the Doughnut hole, right on a chunky pinch on the face of the lower boulder, feet on a horizontal. Climb left and stand up in the hole using large low crimps or the large detached block and throw for the rail in the boulder above. With a good foot (careful not to dab) go straight through the top out.
content.protection: Pads... avoid the big sharp stump to the right,
content.location: The large obvious boulder with a hole in the center splitting it in two. “Mxc” sprayed in white (maximum extreme challenge?).

content.description: Start on the west side of the lowest boulder on a small arete.  Start with both hands on a really cool pinch hold.  Stand up into a nice big undercling hold.  Once you are in the undercling trend left on tough slopers and make a hard foot move.  Small razor crimps and technical feet protect the slopey top out.
A tiny little gneiss bouldering area that has a few gems, some of which are which are pretty hard.
